dateline.placeName: Royal Hotel, AberdeenOn Monday morning, in John Marr’s Music Saloon, CD read the Carol and in the afternoon he read Little Dombey: for his Autumn 1858 Reading tour see Pilgrim Letters 8, passim and Appx H.

body.p: I have received your very welcome note,No doubt forwarded from the office by Wills. and I beg very cordially to thank you. But unfortunately I have not received the newspaper to which your note refers. Could you have the kindness to send me a copy of the SonnetNot traced. I am naturally anxious to read – either to Glasgow (care of Mr Muir Wood,John Muir Wood, of J. M. Wood &amp Co., pianoforte and music sellers, 42 Buchanan Street, Glasgow; CD’s agents for his readings in Glasgow. Buchanan Street), between this and Saturday; or to my house (Tavistock House) in London, afterwards?
